issue.title: Feature: Preserve settings of plugins and limit number of messages in timeline
issue.body:
### What problem does this feature solve?

Hello,

I work at fairly large Vue app and I'm encountering high RAM usage (8GB+ just for Vue dev-tools). I kinda tracked this issue down to frequent Vuex actions - about 5 per second (doubled by mutations). This creates memory leak on my machine in Firefox Developer Edition (107.0b9) on Linux (Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS), which results into OS killing Docker (with dedicated 16GB of RAM). Colleagues using Chrome on Windows or Mac do not have this issue, while I'm encountering it multiple times per day. Therefore I would like to propose 2 new features:
- preserve settings for Vue plugins (e. g.: for disabling timeline),
- introduce new setting to limit number of messages in timeline.

Thanks.

```
System:
    OS: Linux 6.0 Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS
    CPU: (16) x64 AMD Ryzen 7 PRO 5850U with Radeon Graphics
    Memory: 26.81 GB / 30.19 GB
    Container: Yes
    Shell: 5.1.16 - /bin/bash
Browsers:
    Chrome: 107.0.5304.87
    Firefox: 106.0.3
    Firefox Developer Edition: Firefox Developer Edition: 107.0b9
```

$subscribe triggered when unrelated store used for first time in child component (Vue 2)
issue.body:
### Reproduction

https://codesandbox.io/s/pinia-store-usage-in-child-component-triggers-subscribe-in-different-unrelated-store-nvhwq8

### Steps to reproduce the bug

Use the provided CodeSandbox, which includes two stores and two components. The `Parent.vue` component uses the `parent` store and the `Child.vue` component uses the `child` store. These stores do not depend on each other. `Parent.vue` is `$subscribe`d to the `parent` store and will set a `test` variable if the `$subscribe` is triggered.

1. Notice that the value of the `test variable` is `independent` upon loading.
2. Click the button to show the child component.

### Expected behavior

The value of the `test variable` should never be changed from `independent`, as the `parent` store has never been modified.

### Actual behavior

The value of the `test variable` is changed to be `not independent!`, which happens in the `$subscribe` in `Parent.vue`.

### Additional information

### Notes
I ran into this issue using Vue 2.6 and hoped that it might be resolved in Vue 2.7, but it happens in Vue 2.7 as well (as my CodeSandbox shows). 

### Partial Workarounds
1. My real-life use case isn't using a `v-if` to delay the child component's mount, so putting the `$subscribe` in an `onMounted` hook can work around the issue for my current use case. 
2. Using the child's store in the top level `App.vue` (depending on how the app loads) can also alleviate the issue, but is non-ideal as it would seem that part of the goal of using composable-like stores is so that they can be used in whichever components actually need them.

### Expected behavior

### Actual behavior

### Additional information

issue.title: After 2 minutes, it unloads itself
issue.body:
### Vue devtools version

6.4.5

### Link to minimal reproduction

N/A

### Steps to reproduce & screenshots

Sorry, no reproduction. I don't know what causes the problem, so I have no way of knowing how to make a reproduction.

1. Go to a Vue2 website in Firefox
2. Open the devtools
3. Wait a few minutes
4. Maybe you have to do some random stuff in the devtools


### What is expected?

Nothing happens. Devtools stays open, and stays functional.

### What is actually happening?

One of two things may happen:

1. The devtools unloads itself, showing just its logo.
2. The devtools reloads itself, undoing any changes and closing the tree.

In either case, should I have been debugging, making changes, etc, I can just go and start all over. Any work that I'm doing in the devtools is rudely interrupted and goes poof, i.e. it doesn't remember any changes and doesn't recover them.

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.19044
    CPU: (12) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-8950HK CPU @ 2.90GHz
    Memory: 10.41 GB / 31.76 GB
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.18.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
    npm: 8.19.2 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 106.0.5249.119
    Edge: Spartan (44.19041.1266.0), Chromium (106.0.1370.52)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.19041.1566
  npmPackages:
    vue: ^2.6.14 => 2.6.14
```

I don't know why so many people use this script, it's poop. Firefox is not in there.
```


### Any additional comments?

Worked fine in some older version. Don't know which one, since browser addons update fully automatically.

issue.title: Data refs that start with "use" are not visible in Vue dev tools
issue.body:
### Vue devtools version

6.4.5

### Link to minimal reproduction

https://github.com/gogo-rulez/vue-devtools-bug

### Steps to reproduce & screenshots

- npm install
- npm run dev
- open in browser
- open vue devtools
- the refs starting with "use" are not listed in the setup tab of App.vue

### What is expected?

To see all of the refs defined in App.vue file

### What is actually happening?

Only refs which do not start with "use" are visible in the devtools setup tab

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.22000
    CPU: (8) x64 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-1185G7 @ 3.00GHz
    Memory: 1.90 GB / 15.73 GB
Binaries:
    Node: 16.15.0 - ~\nvm\nodejs\bin\node.EXE
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - ~\AppData\Roaming\npm\yarn.CMD
    npm: 8.19.2 - ~\nvm\nodejs\bin\npm.CMD
Browsers:
    Edge: Spartan (44.22000.120.0), Chromium (106.0.1370.47)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.22000.120
```


### Any additional comments?

We went on and downloaded the devtools source code to look for the cause.
The only thing that we could find is in this file
`/packages/app-backend-vue3/src/components/data.ts`
inside function `processSetupState ` the startsWith method is used like so `!key.startsWith('use)`

this may or may not be the thing that is causing the problem

I've tested with vue-cli@5 with typescript.

issue.title: dist/vue.esm.js 2.7.10 has mixed EOL - build is unstable
issue.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2228672/194721564-d10504c3-54c2-4752-96ac-c5bda95a1e34.png)

in atk4/ui framework we precompile and ship built JS files together with other changes

when we tried to upgrade from vue 2.6.14 to 2.7.10 we observed the EOL in the dist files is mixed

this is causing our builds to be unstable in environments where EOL git normalization is enabled

to fix the problem, please unify all EOL of text files to industry standard NL (no Windows CRLF)

once fixed, please issue a bugfix release, thanks!

issue.title: Documentation does not explain whether the loader rule or the plugin takes the options
issue.body: When trying to use `VueLoaderPlugin` and `'vue-loader'`, the documentation doesn't explain where the options should go. Since in webpack, loaders can have options specified in the `use` list of a `RuleSetRule`, they could go there. But the plugin constructor could take them too. The documentation makes no mention of which one should be given the options.

issue.title: Cannot find module 'cache-loader' error when trying to upgrade to webpack 5
issue.body:
I am trying to upgrade from webpack 4 to webpack 5. Everything seems to have been updated & modified correctly now, except vue-loader.
Whenever I try to create a build, I run into a lot of errors, all of the same form:
```
Module build failed (from ./node_modules/vue-loader/lib/loaders/pitcher.js):
Error: Cannot find module 'cache-loader'
```

I am using:
- vue 2.7.0
- webpack 5.74.0
- webpack-cli 4.10.0
- vue-loader: 15.9.8
- vue-template-compiler: 2.7.0
- NPM 8.6.0
- Node 16.17.0
(The only globally installed NPM packages are npm and sass.)

What I have tried so far:
- I started the upgrade using vue-loader 15.10.0, but that gave the same errors;
- I have tried it with vue 2.6.x, as some people reported here that this solved the problem when combined with vue-loader 15.9.8;
- I have removed the node_modules directory and tried a clean install. I also tried the same, after deleting the package-lock.json file;
- I tried: "npm install vue-template-compiler@2.7.0 vue-loader@15.9.8 --save-dev --legacy-peer-deps", as some people reported that this solved build problems for them;

Before the webpack upgrade I was using vue 2.7.0 and vue-loader 15.10.0, and it worked without any problems.

issue.title: Vue devtool did not reactive when I use on the fly reactive object pushing and manipulation with v-model in runtime
issue.body:
### Vue version

3.2.38

### Link to minimal reproduction

https://github.com/amm834/vue-supabase-workout-app

### Steps to reproduce

- click `Create` nav link.
- Select Workout Type and then click `Add Exercise`
- It will show up the following input.

![Screenshot (19)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65492233/190932287-97b220d9-f563-40b8-b324-b937688707a1.png)

- Open dev tool and watch the input form `v-model` state. It is reactive.
- And click `Add Exercise` you will see the generated form input as following

![Screenshot (20)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65492233/190932342-ef6e66c1-5db1-4876-916f-10df771fdef6.png)

- open dev tool and watch the second input.
- its `v-model` won't be reactive. That is bug. It is not working vue's deep reactivity.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65492233/190932427-5d0ded92-80e9-4a45-958e-49419043d640.png)

see
https://github.com/amm834/vue-supabase-workout-app/blob/3a208d09a5b19103806c2195c91ac4d3d7fd3a6a/src/components/CreateWorkout.vue#L69

I have to initialize for union typed array, if i don't initalize that nothing will be shown when i select that workout type.

see
https://github.com/amm834/vue-supabase-workout-app/blob/3a208d09a5b19103806c2195c91ac4d3d7fd3a6a/src/components/CreateWorkout.vue#L71

`It is the problem of lost of deep reactivity.` 
According to the vue doc it should work as expected. But it is not working.



### What is expected?

Object inside that array should be reactive when I use it with `v-model`

### What is actually happening?

Reactive object is lost of it behavior what you called `reactive` inside the array. Vue doc mentioned object inside the array is reactive cuz of deep reactive mechanism but it is not working as expceted to be vue doc mentioned .

See
https://vuejs.org/guide/extras/reactivity-in-depth.html

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.22000
    CPU: (4) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-6300U CPU @ 2.40GHz
    Memory: 1.35 GB / 7.66 GB
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.15.1 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
    npm: 8.11.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD
  Browsers:
    Edge: Spartan (44.22000.120.0), Chromium (105.0.1343.42)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.22000.120
  npmPackages:
    vue: ^3.2.38 => 3.2.39
```


### Any additional comments?

Write more example and documentation for vue typescript. And example for how to manipulate with complex data structure and `v-model`. In fact, vue is lack of expert example in vue doc. Please provide that. 

If vue support on the fly `v-model` value that can be a great feature for us.

issue.title: Production bundle for common.js inlcudes 'let' keyword
issue.body:
Since version 2.7 production bundle for common.js (vue.common.prod.js) includes 'let' keyword. This breaks old webpack 3 production builds with UglifyJS.

Is it really necessary to use 'let' keyword there ? Can't it be transpiled like in version 2.6 ?

issue.body:
### What problem does this feature solve?

Hello,

I work at fairly large Vue app and I'm encountering high RAM usage (8GB+ just for Vue dev-tools). I kinda tracked this issue down to frequent Vuex actions - about 5 per second (doubled by mutations). This creates memory leak on my machine in Firefox Developer Edition (107.0b9) on Linux (Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS), which results into OS killing Docker (with dedicated 16GB of RAM). Colleagues using Chrome on Windows or Mac do not have this issue, while I'm encountering it multiple times per day. Therefore I would like to propose 2 new features:
- preserve settings for Vue plugins (e. g.: for disabling timeline),
- introduce new setting to limit number of messages in timeline.

$subscribe triggered when unrelated store used for first time in child component (Vue 2)
issue.body:
### Reproduction

https://codesandbox.io/s/pinia-store-usage-in-child-component-triggers-subscribe-in-different-unrelated-store-nvhwq8

### Steps to reproduce the bug

Use the provided CodeSandbox, which includes two stores and two components. The `Parent.vue` component uses the `parent` store and the `Child.vue` component uses the `child` store. These stores do not depend on each other. `Parent.vue` is `$subscribe`d to the `parent` store and will set a `test` variable if the `$subscribe` is triggered.

1. Notice that the value of the `test variable` is `independent` upon loading.
2. Click the button to show the child component.

### Expected behavior

The value of the `test variable` should never be changed from `independent`, as the `parent` store has never been modified.

### Actual behavior

The value of the `test variable` is changed to be `not independent!`, which happens in the `$subscribe` in `Parent.vue`.

### Additional information

### Notes
I ran into this issue using Vue 2.6 and hoped that it might be resolved in Vue 2.7, but it happens in Vue 2.7 as well (as my CodeSandbox shows). 

### Partial Workarounds
1. My real-life use case isn't using a `v-if` to delay the child component's mount, so putting the `$subscribe` in an `onMounted` hook can work around the issue for my current use case. 
2. Using the child's store in the top level `App.vue` (depending on how the app loads) can also alleviate the issue, but is non-ideal as it would seem that part of the goal of using composable-like stores is so that they can be used in whichever components actually need them.

2. Click the button to show the child component.

### Expected behavior

### Actual behavior

The value of the `test variable` is changed to be `not independent!`, which happens in the `$subscribe` in `Parent.vue`.

### Additional information

### Notes
I ran into this issue using Vue 2.6 and hoped that it might be resolved in Vue 2.7, but it happens in Vue 2.7 as well (as my CodeSandbox shows). 

### Partial Workarounds

issue.title: After 2 minutes, it unloads itself
issue.body:
### Vue devtools version

6.4.5

### Link to minimal reproduction

N/A

### Steps to reproduce & screenshots

Sorry, no reproduction. I don't know what causes the problem, so I have no way of knowing how to make a reproduction.

1. Go to a Vue2 website in Firefox
2. Open the devtools
3. Wait a few minutes
4. Maybe you have to do some random stuff in the devtools


### What is expected?

Nothing happens. Devtools stays open, and stays functional.

### What is actually happening?

One of two things may happen:

1. The devtools unloads itself, showing just its logo.
2. The devtools reloads itself, undoing any changes and closing the tree.

In either case, should I have been debugging, making changes, etc, I can just go and start all over. Any work that I'm doing in the devtools is rudely interrupted and goes poof, i.e. it doesn't remember any changes and doesn't recover them.

issue.title: Data refs that start with "use" are not visible in Vue dev tools
issue.body:
### Vue devtools version

6.4.5

### Link to minimal reproduction

https://github.com/gogo-rulez/vue-devtools-bug

### Steps to reproduce & screenshots

- npm install
- npm run dev
- open in browser
- open vue devtools
- the refs starting with "use" are not listed in the setup tab of App.vue

### What is expected?

To see all of the refs defined in App.vue file

### What is actually happening?

Only refs which do not start with "use" are visible in the devtools setup tab

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.22000
    CPU: (8) x64 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-1185G7 @ 3.00GHz
    Memory: 1.90 GB / 15.73 GB
Binaries:
    Node: 16.15.0 - ~\nvm\nodejs\bin\node.EXE
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - ~\AppData\Roaming\npm\yarn.CMD
    npm: 8.19.2 - ~\nvm\nodejs\bin\npm.CMD
Browsers:
    Edge: Spartan (44.22000.120.0), Chromium (106.0.1370.47)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.22000.120
```


### Any additional comments?

We went on and downloaded the devtools source code to look for the cause.
The only thing that we could find is in this file
`/packages/app-backend-vue3/src/components/data.ts`
inside function `processSetupState ` the startsWith method is used like so `!key.startsWith('use)`

this may or may not be the thing that is causing the problem

issue.title: dist/vue.esm.js 2.7.10 has mixed EOL - build is unstable
issue.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2228672/194721564-d10504c3-54c2-4752-96ac-c5bda95a1e34.png)

in atk4/ui framework we precompile and ship built JS files together with other changes

when we tried to upgrade from vue 2.6.14 to 2.7.10 we observed the EOL in the dist files is mixed

this is causing our builds to be unstable in environments where EOL git normalization is enabled

to fix the problem, please unify all EOL of text files to industry standard NL (no Windows CRLF)

once fixed, please issue a bugfix release, thanks!

issue.title: Documentation does not explain whether the loader rule or the plugin takes the options
issue.body: When trying to use `VueLoaderPlugin` and `'vue-loader'`, the documentation doesn't explain where the options should go. Since in webpack, loaders can have options specified in the `use` list of a `RuleSetRule`, they could go there. But the plugin constructor could take them too. The documentation makes no mention of which one should be given the options.

issue.title: Cannot find module 'cache-loader' error when trying to upgrade to webpack 5
issue.body:
I am trying to upgrade from webpack 4 to webpack 5. Everything seems to have been updated & modified correctly now, except vue-loader.
Whenever I try to create a build, I run into a lot of errors, all of the same form:
```
Module build failed (from ./node_modules/vue-loader/lib/loaders/pitcher.js):
Error: Cannot find module 'cache-loader'
```

I am using:
- vue 2.7.0
- webpack 5.74.0
- webpack-cli 4.10.0
- vue-loader: 15.9.8
- vue-template-compiler: 2.7.0
- NPM 8.6.0
- Node 16.17.0
(The only globally installed NPM packages are npm and sass.)

What I have tried so far:
- I started the upgrade using vue-loader 15.10.0, but that gave the same errors;
- I have tried it with vue 2.6.x, as some people reported here that this solved the problem when combined with vue-loader 15.9.8;
- I have removed the node_modules directory and tried a clean install. I also tried the same, after deleting the package-lock.json file;
- I tried: "npm install vue-template-compiler@2.7.0 vue-loader@15.9.8 --save-dev --legacy-peer-deps", as some people reported that this solved build problems for them;

Before the webpack upgrade I was using vue 2.7.0 and vue-loader 15.10.0, and it worked without any problems.

issue.title: Vue devtool did not reactive when I use on the fly reactive object pushing and manipulation with v-model in runtime
issue.body:
### Vue version

3.2.38

### Link to minimal reproduction

https://github.com/amm834/vue-supabase-workout-app

### Steps to reproduce

- click `Create` nav link.
- Select Workout Type and then click `Add Exercise`
- It will show up the following input.

![Screenshot (19)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65492233/190932287-97b220d9-f563-40b8-b324-b937688707a1.png)

- Open dev tool and watch the input form `v-model` state. It is reactive.
- And click `Add Exercise` you will see the generated form input as following

![Screenshot (20)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65492233/190932342-ef6e66c1-5db1-4876-916f-10df771fdef6.png)

- open dev tool and watch the second input.
- its `v-model` won't be reactive. That is bug. It is not working vue's deep reactivity.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65492233/190932427-5d0ded92-80e9-4a45-958e-49419043d640.png)

see
https://github.com/amm834/vue-supabase-workout-app/blob/3a208d09a5b19103806c2195c91ac4d3d7fd3a6a/src/components/CreateWorkout.vue#L69

I have to initialize for union typed array, if i don't initalize that nothing will be shown when i select that workout type.

see
https://github.com/amm834/vue-supabase-workout-app/blob/3a208d09a5b19103806c2195c91ac4d3d7fd3a6a/src/components/CreateWorkout.vue#L71

`It is the problem of lost of deep reactivity.` 
According to the vue doc it should work as expected. But it is not working.



### What is expected?

Object inside that array should be reactive when I use it with `v-model`

### What is actually happening?

Reactive object is lost of it behavior what you called `reactive` inside the array. Vue doc mentioned object inside the array is reactive cuz of deep reactive mechanism but it is not working as expceted to be vue doc mentioned .

See
https://vuejs.org/guide/extras/reactivity-in-depth.html

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.22000
    CPU: (4) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-6300U CPU @ 2.40GHz
    Memory: 1.35 GB / 7.66 GB
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.15.1 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
    npm: 8.11.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD
  Browsers:
    Edge: Spartan (44.22000.120.0), Chromium (105.0.1343.42)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.22000.120
  npmPackages:
    vue: ^3.2.38 => 3.2.39
```


### Any additional comments?

Write more example and documentation for vue typescript. And example for how to manipulate with complex data structure and `v-model`. In fact, vue is lack of expert example in vue doc. Please provide that. 

If vue support on the fly `v-model` value that can be a great feature for us.

issue.title: Feature: Preserve settings of plugins and limit number of messages in timeline
issue.body:
### What problem does this feature solve?

Hello,

I work at fairly large Vue app and I'm encountering high RAM usage (8GB+ just for Vue dev-tools). I kinda tracked this issue down to frequent Vuex actions - about 5 per second (doubled by mutations). This creates memory leak on my machine in Firefox Developer Edition (107.0b9) on Linux (Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS), which results into OS killing Docker (with dedicated 16GB of RAM). Colleagues using Chrome on Windows or Mac do not have this issue, while I'm encountering it multiple times per day. Therefore I would like to propose 2 new features:
- preserve settings for Vue plugins (e. g.: for disabling timeline),
- introduce new setting to limit number of messages in timeline.

Thanks.

$subscribe triggered when unrelated store used for first time in child component (Vue 2)
issue.body:
### Reproduction

https://codesandbox.io/s/pinia-store-usage-in-child-component-triggers-subscribe-in-different-unrelated-store-nvhwq8

### Steps to reproduce the bug

Use the provided CodeSandbox, which includes two stores and two components. The `Parent.vue` component uses the `parent` store and the `Child.vue` component uses the `child` store. These stores do not depend on each other. `Parent.vue` is `$subscribe`d to the `parent` store and will set a `test` variable if the `$subscribe` is triggered.

1. Notice that the value of the `test variable` is `independent` upon loading.
2. Click the button to show the child component.

### Expected behavior

The value of the `test variable` should never be changed from `independent`, as the `parent` store has never been modified.

### Actual behavior

The value of the `test variable` is changed to be `not independent!`, which happens in the `$subscribe` in `Parent.vue`.

### Additional information

### Notes
I ran into this issue using Vue 2.6 and hoped that it might be resolved in Vue 2.7, but it happens in Vue 2.7 as well (as my CodeSandbox shows). 

### Partial Workarounds
1. My real-life use case isn't using a `v-if` to delay the child component's mount, so putting the `$subscribe` in an `onMounted` hook can work around the issue for my current use case. 
2. Using the child's store in the top level `App.vue` (depending on how the app loads) can also alleviate the issue, but is non-ideal as it would seem that part of the goal of using composable-like stores is so that they can be used in whichever components actually need them.

These stores do not depend on each other. `Parent.vue` is `$subscribe`d to the `parent` store and will set a `test` variable if the `$subscribe` is triggered.

1. Notice that the value of the `test variable` is `independent` upon loading.
2. Click the button to show the child component.

### Expected behavior

The value of the `test variable` should never be changed from `independent`, as the `parent` store has never been modified.

### Actual behavior

The value of the `test variable` is changed to be `not independent!`, which happens in the `$subscribe` in `Parent.vue`.

### Additional information

### Notes
I ran into this issue using Vue 2.6 and hoped that it might be resolved in Vue 2.7, but it happens in Vue 2.7 as well (as my CodeSandbox shows). 

### Partial Workarounds
1. My real-life use case isn't using a `v-if` to delay the child component's mount, so putting the `$subscribe` in an `onMounted` hook can work around the issue for my current use case.

issue.title: After 2 minutes, it unloads itself
issue.body:
### Vue devtools version

6.4.5

### Link to minimal reproduction

N/A

### Steps to reproduce & screenshots

Sorry, no reproduction. I don't know what causes the problem, so I have no way of knowing how to make a reproduction.

1. Go to a Vue2 website in Firefox
2. Open the devtools
3. Wait a few minutes
4. Maybe you have to do some random stuff in the devtools


### What is expected?

Nothing happens. Devtools stays open, and stays functional.

### What is actually happening?

One of two things may happen:

1. The devtools unloads itself, showing just its logo.
2. The devtools reloads itself, undoing any changes and closing the tree.

In either case, should I have been debugging, making changes, etc, I can just go and start all over. Any work that I'm doing in the devtools is rudely interrupted and goes poof, i.e. it doesn't remember any changes and doesn't recover them.

### System Info

```shell
System:

issue.title: Data refs that start with "use" are not visible in Vue dev tools
issue.body:
### Vue devtools version

6.4.5

### Link to minimal reproduction

https://github.com/gogo-rulez/vue-devtools-bug

### Steps to reproduce & screenshots

- npm install
- npm run dev
- open in browser
- open vue devtools
- the refs starting with "use" are not listed in the setup tab of App.vue

### What is expected?

To see all of the refs defined in App.vue file

### What is actually happening?

Only refs which do not start with "use" are visible in the devtools setup tab

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.22000
    CPU: (8) x64 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-1185G7 @ 3.00GHz
    Memory: 1.90 GB / 15.73 GB
Binaries:
    Node: 16.15.0 - ~\nvm\nodejs\bin\node.EXE
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - ~\AppData\Roaming\npm\yarn.CMD
    npm: 8.19.2 - ~\nvm\nodejs\bin\npm.CMD
Browsers:
    Edge: Spartan (44.22000.120.0), Chromium (106.0.1370.47)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.22000.120
```


### Any additional comments?

We went on and downloaded the devtools source code to look for the cause.
The only thing that we could find is in this file
`/packages/app-backend-vue3/src/components/data.ts`
inside function `processSetupState ` the startsWith method is used like so `!key.startsWith('use)`

this may or may not be the thing that is causing the problem

issue.title: dist/vue.esm.js 2.7.10 has mixed EOL - build is unstable
issue.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2228672/194721564-d10504c3-54c2-4752-96ac-c5bda95a1e34.png)

in atk4/ui framework we precompile and ship built JS files together with other changes

when we tried to upgrade from vue 2.6.14 to 2.7.10 we observed the EOL in the dist files is mixed

this is causing our builds to be unstable in environments where EOL git normalization is enabled

to fix the problem, please unify all EOL of text files to industry standard NL (no Windows CRLF)

once fixed, please issue a bugfix release, thanks!

issue.title: Documentation does not explain whether the loader rule or the plugin takes the options
issue.body: When trying to use `VueLoaderPlugin` and `'vue-loader'`, the documentation doesn't explain where the options should go. Since in webpack, loaders can have options specified in the `use` list of a `RuleSetRule`, they could go there. But the plugin constructor could take them too. The documentation makes no mention of which one should be given the options.

issue.title: Cannot find module 'cache-loader' error when trying to upgrade to webpack 5
issue.body:
I am trying to upgrade from webpack 4 to webpack 5. Everything seems to have been updated & modified correctly now, except vue-loader.
Whenever I try to create a build, I run into a lot of errors, all of the same form:
```
Module build failed (from ./node_modules/vue-loader/lib/loaders/pitcher.js):
Error: Cannot find module 'cache-loader'
```

I am using:
- vue 2.7.0
- webpack 5.74.0
- webpack-cli 4.10.0
- vue-loader: 15.9.8
- vue-template-compiler: 2.7.0
- NPM 8.6.0
- Node 16.17.0
(The only globally installed NPM packages are npm and sass.)

What I have tried so far:
- I started the upgrade using vue-loader 15.10.0, but that gave the same errors;
- I have tried it with vue 2.6.x, as some people reported here that this solved the problem when combined with vue-loader 15.9.8;
- I have removed the node_modules directory and tried a clean install. I also tried the same, after deleting the package-lock.json file;
- I tried: "npm install vue-template-compiler@2.7.0 vue-loader@15.9.8 --save-dev --legacy-peer-deps", as some people reported that this solved build problems for them;

Before the webpack upgrade I was using vue 2.7.0 and vue-loader 15.10.0, and it worked without any problems.

issue.title: Vue devtool did not reactive when I use on the fly reactive object pushing and manipulation with v-model in runtime
issue.body:
### Vue version

3.2.38

### Link to minimal reproduction

https://github.com/amm834/vue-supabase-workout-app

### Steps to reproduce

- click `Create` nav link.
- Select Workout Type and then click `Add Exercise`
- It will show up the following input.

![Screenshot (19)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65492233/190932287-97b220d9-f563-40b8-b324-b937688707a1.png)

- Open dev tool and watch the input form `v-model` state. It is reactive.
- And click `Add Exercise` you will see the generated form input as following

![Screenshot (20)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65492233/190932342-ef6e66c1-5db1-4876-916f-10df771fdef6.png)

- open dev tool and watch the second input.
- its `v-model` won't be reactive. That is bug. It is not working vue's deep reactivity.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65492233/190932427-5d0ded92-80e9-4a45-958e-49419043d640.png)

see
https://github.com/amm834/vue-supabase-workout-app/blob/3a208d09a5b19103806c2195c91ac4d3d7fd3a6a/src/components/CreateWorkout.vue#L69

issue.title: Production bundle for common.js inlcudes 'let' keyword
issue.body:
Since version 2.7 production bundle for common.js (vue.common.prod.js) includes 'let' keyword. This breaks old webpack 3 production builds with UglifyJS.

Is it really necessary to use 'let' keyword there ? Can't it be transpiled like in version 2.6 ?

issue.title: [CVE-2022-37558]/prototype-pollution found in  vue-router.esm.js
issue.body:
Prototype pollution vulnerability in function VueRouter in vue-router.esm.js in vuejs vue-router 3.5.3 via the key variable in vue-router.esm.js.

The prototype pollution vulnerability can be mitigated with several best practices described here:
https://learn.snyk.io/lessons/prototype-pollution/javascript/
